renameLdapEntry
The function for renaming an existing entry in the Microsoft Active Directory Service (hereinafter the AD) when connected via the LDAP protocol.
To change the values of entry attributes, use
updateLdapEntry
.
Syntax
renameLdapEntry
(obj, entryDn, dnWithNewName)
Setting
Purpose
obj
Object with settings for connecting  to the directory service via the LDAP protocol. Find more details
here
.
As a value, using
dict
, select an object of the "LDAP connection settings" [SYS_LDAP_SETTINGS] type.
entryDn
Directory of the entry whose name needs to be changed.
The parameter is provided as
text
.
Specify the full path
including
the root directory defined in the
LDAP connection settings
.
dnWithNewName
Specifying the directory of the entry taking into account the new name.
The parameter is provided as
text
.
Specify the full path
including
the root directory defined in the
LDAP connection settings
.
Note
Adding the function is carried out by manual entry.
Use example
For example,
integration of the application with AD
is configured and the AD directory service contains user entries. Within the example, the names of user entries in the directory service include users’ first and last names.
It is required to rename a user’s entry due to a surname change.
The algorithm may be as follows:
Using the
renameLdapEntry
function, the name of the entry in the AD directory service is changed. Where:
the first parameter of the function specifies the object with settings for connecting to the AD service using
dict
;
the second parameter is the entry directory;
the third parameter is the entry directory taking into account the new name.
The following functions were also used to write the algorithm.
Due to the user’s surname change, it is also necessary to change the value of the "Second name" attribute. To do this:
using
replaceLdapAttribute
, specify the new value for the "Second name" attribute. The changes represent an array set via the
new variable
"modifications";
using
updateLdapEntry
, the specified value is passed to the AD directory service.
